paper_abstract: The volume array coil in the magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) system is a typical application of the distributed sensor network in the biomedical area. Each coil provides a large coverage of the imaged object, and the signals are largely overlapped during the data acquisition. The intercoil image similarities can be explored for the distributed compressed sensing (CS) based image reconstruction. In this work, a singular value decomposition (SVD) based sparsity basis was developed for the CS-MRI with a volume array coil configuration. In this novel imaging method, the spatial correlation both of intracoil and intercoil exploited. The experimental results showed that is with eightfold undersampled k-space data acquisition, the target images could still be faithfully reconstructed using the proposed method, which offered a better imaging performance compared to conventional CS schemes.
paper_title: Distributed Compressed Sensing MRI Using Volume Array Coil
